lexUnit.name: puff.v
lexUnit.definition: quickly suck in smoke of tobacco or a drug

sentence.text: Hauser puffed at his cigarette .
The air was thick with cigarette and cigar smoke ; a number of the twelve men seated there puffed away quite happily while they talked .
For a moment , they sat in silence , Kinane puffing at his cigarette , the pungent smell of cheap , strong tobacco wafting across to Kelly .
They were relaxed and puffing on cigarettes ; it was clear that any responsibility for the inert procession which now crocodiled back out of the village failed to bother them .
Smokers screw up their eyes and lips when they puff a cigarette and this can surely lead to more wrinkles .
He was puffing a fat cigar , the smoke concealing his facial features .
Before he poured me a drink M. Chaillot stood puffing his cigar and fondling the breasts of one of the figures .
He puffed thoughtfully on the cigar then turned back to face Whitlock and Sabrina .

Perched on the tailboard of a tiny wooden malabar pulled by two short-legged Cambodian ponies , Senator Nathaniel Sherman was puffing reflectively on a Havana cigar as he surveyed the early morning scene .
He filled his pipe with tobacco , lit it and , puffing clouds of smoke , he walked away , turning round to shout , ` Demain , " and pointing to the cottage .
Bragg laid a match across the bowl of his pipe , and puffed until the air was blue around him .
The commander puffed his pipe and looked puzzled .
With a cry of rage , he puffed on his much-chewed stogie and fired at us .
Bragg pondered , puffing steadily at his pipe .
Sylvie puffed at her cigarettes , and then in the middle of one of Katherine 's sentences abruptly stood up .
The actors paced in the wings puffing on cigarettes , watching the sliding door in case the fireman should catch them .
Stanley puffed on his pipe and beamed .
They returned to their seats ; Maurice puffed at his pipe and seemed more relaxed .
Insurers say a non-smoker is someone who has not puffed the weed for 12 months and does n't plan smoking again .
Croughton the pot-bellied potman leant back in his beer crate refuge and puffed upon his cigarette .
